title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Martin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin (2026). iaschooldata: Fetch Process Iowa School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data},   author = {Andrew Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata}, }

what: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started Fetch analyze Iowa public school enrollment data Iowa Department Education.

what: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: 34 years enrollment data (1992-2025). 515,000 students today. 320 districts. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: neighboring states lose students, Iowa held steady around 500,000 students three decades. boom, bust.
code: library(iaschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(1995, 2000, 2005, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2025))  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
what: 2. Des Moines is the only large district
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Des Moines Public Schools serves 33,000 students, nearly 10x larger next biggest district. Iowa education fundamentally rural.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Hispanic students went 2% 13% enrollment since 1992. Meatpacking towns like Storm Lake, Denison, Marshalltown now majority Hispanic. Storm Lake Community School District now 70% Hispanic.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "hispanic") %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Iowa lost 8,000 students COVID, one smallest drops nation. state’s rural character may helped.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Iowa 400 districts 1992. Today around 320. Every year, rural districts merge enrollment shrinks.
code: purrr::map_df(c(1995, 2005, 2015, 2025), fetch_enr) %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_districts = n())

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Iowa’s smallest districts serve just hundred students. Ringgold County fewer 200. economics small-town education brutal.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   filter(n_students < 300) %>%   arrange(n_students) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Unlike many states kindergarten enrollment plummeting, Iowa’s kindergarten numbers remain stable. Birth rates collapsed.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Iowa’s ELL population grew 10,000 35,000 students since 2000. Schools rural communities now need ESL teachers.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2000:2025) %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "lep") %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Waukee, Ankeny, West Des Moines suburbs growing. Rural districts lose dozen students year. Two Iowas emerging.
code: suburbs <- c("Waukee Community School District", "Ankeny Community School District",              "West Des Moines Community School District")  enr %>%   filter(district_name %in% suburbs, is_district,          grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = district_name, values_from = n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with iaschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Despite demographic shifts, Iowa public schools still predominantly white. Black students concentrated Des Moines, Davenport, Waterloo.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(pct))

title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
code: library(iaschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # Fetch ALL 34 years of data (1992-2025) enr_all <- fetch_enr_multi(1992:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics by district enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   group_by(district_name, subgroup) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Levels: State, district (~320), school (~1,200) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Grade levels: Pre-K Grade 12 Special populations: English Learners, Free/Reduced Lunch

title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Iowa uses AEA (Area Education Agency) structure: - District ID: 4-digit code (e.g., 1350 Des Moines) - School ID: Building numbers within districts

title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: Iowa Department Education: Education Statistics

what: Part of the 50 State Schooldata Family
title: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data
text: package part family R packages providing school enrollment data 50 US states. package fetches data directly state’s Department Education. See also: njschooldata - original state schooldata package New Jersey. packages: github.com/almartin82

Fetch Iowa enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Iowa Department Education's Education Statistics page.

title: Fetch Iowa enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch Iowa enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 1947-2025, though years missing (1948, 1950, 1952, 1954, 1971, 1972). Note: Historical data (1947-1991) contains grade-level enrollment. Modern data (1992+) includes demographics gender breakdowns. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download Iowa DOE.

title: Fetch Iowa enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, school_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Iowa enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get historical data (1969-70 school year) enr_1970 <- fetch_enr(1970)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district des_moines <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(district_id == "1350") } # }

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data — iaschooldata-package
title: iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data — iaschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Iowa Department Education. Provides functions fetching enrollment data transforming tidy format analysis.

title: iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data — iaschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years Get available data years

title: iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data — iaschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data — iaschooldata-package
text: Iowa uses district numbers primary identifiers: District IDs: 4-digit codes (e.g., 0000 = state, 0009 = Adair-Casey) School IDs: Building-level identifiers within districts

title: iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data — iaschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Iowa Department Education: Education Statistics: https://educate.iowa.gov/pk-12/data/education-statistics Certified Enrollment: https://educate.iowa.gov/pk-12/data/data-collections/certified-enrollment/public-schools

title: iaschooldata: Fetch and Process Iowa School Data — iaschooldata-package
text: Years: 1992-2025 (34 years historical data) Aggregation levels: State, District, School Demographics: Race/ethnicity, gender Grade levels: PK, K, 1-12
